title: Watch live: Scientists releasing more images from Webb telescope today
summary: Scientists will release additional images and data from the James Webb Space Telescope today, including ultra-sharp infrared views of a star-forming nebula, a colorful cloud of gas around a dying star, a group of distant galaxies, and the first measurement of the composition of a planet around another star. The images will be released at 10:30 a.m. EDT (1430 GMT).

title: BAE Systems delivers jam-resistant GPS receivers to Germany
summary: BAE Systems delivered to Germany advanced GPS M-code receivers.

title: Space cybersecurity firm SpiderOak adds retired general Pawlikowski to its advisory board
summary: Space cybersecurity firm SpiderOak on July 12 announced the appointment of former DoD and military officials to its advisory board.

title: China to target near-Earth object 2020 PN1 for asteroid deflection mission
summary: China has set its sights on near-Earth object 202 PN1 as the target for a combined asteroid deflection and observation test mission due to launch in 2026.

title: BlackSky and Esri unveil tasking through ArcGIS Online
summary: BlackSky Technology unveiled satellite tasking July 12 through Esri’s ArcGIS Online geographic mapping platform.

title: Earth imagery companies reimagine satellite tasking
summary: Earth observation startups and established firms have streamlined satellite tasking.

title: Starship booster test ends in fiery anomaly
summary: A test of the booster for SpaceX’s first orbital Starship vehicle July 11 ended with flames erupting unexpectedly from the base of the vehicle, triggering a fire at the pad.

title: ABL static fires rocket for first orbital launch attempt
summary: ABL Space Systems successfully test-fired the rocket it plans to launch on the company’s first flight in the next several weeks.

title: NASA releases first color image from James Webb Space Telescope
summary: A deep field of distant galaxies, some dating back to the first billion years after the Big Bang, is the first full-color image to come from the James Webb Space Telescope.

title: Webb telescope peers deeper into the universe than ever before
summary: The world got its deepest ever look into the distant universe Monday with the release of the first full-color science image from the James Webb Space Telescope, revealing thousands of faint galaxies shining like lampposts in a patch of speck of sky the size of a grain of sand held at arm’s length.
